notes: When interrupted during the channeling, Meteor Hammer does nothing, wasting the cooldown and mana.
The visual effect at the target area during the channeling is visible to allies only.
The visual effect around the caster is visible to everyone who has vision on the caster.
The casting sound effect is audible to everyone who has vision on the caster.
The meteor takes 0.5 seconds to hit the ground after the channeling.
Upon landing, all enemies within the impact radius, including buildings but excluding wards, get damaged, stunned, and receive a damaging debuff.
The meteor first applies the debuffs, then the impact damage.

Deals damage in 1-second intervals, starting 1 second after the debuff is placed, resulting in 7 total instances, including the impact damage. Can deal a total of 510 (TagTalent 435) damage (before reductions).
Can deal a total of 510 (TagTalent 435) damage (before reductions).
Multiple casts on the same targets do not stack, but refresh the duration instead. Stacks with the debuff of Fallen Sky.
Stacks with the debuff of Fallen Sky.
Provides flying vision within the targeted area for 3.8 seconds, starting upon channel beginning. This vision stays even when the channeling gets canceled.
This vision stays even when the channeling gets canceled.
Does not share cooldown with Fallen Sky.
abilities.description: After a successful channel, summons a meteor that strikes a 400 AoE, stunning enemies for 1.25 seconds and dealing impact damage. Continues to deal damage over time to enemy units and buildings for 6 seconds.

additionalInformation: The item's attributes grants the following additional bonuses:
8 main attack damage to all / / heroes.
name: Meteor Hammer
description: An enchanted hammer forged of metals discovered in the ruins of a village destroyed by a great star storm.
tips: Meteor Hammer can be hard to aim, as the long and obvious casting allows most opponents to interrupt or dodge the ability. Use the active in conjunction with disables, or after the target has expended their escape abilities.
If you find yourself vulnerable to disables, you want to invest for a Black King Bar or a Linken's Sphere to prevent your channelling from getting interrupted easily.
Meteor Hammer can be considered a situational item for teams that require extra siege power, as it deals 375 damage against buildings (about 1/4 of the HP of a Tier 1 tower).
Meteor Hammer can be used to quickly clear jungle stacks and creep waves.
